submission:
class Solution:
    def countSubarrays(self, nums, k):
        count = 0
        n = len(nums)
        prev = defaultdict(int)
        
        for i in range(n):
            curr = defaultdict(int)
            
            if nums[i] == k: count += 1
            curr[nums[i]] += 1
            
            for key in prev:
                new_key = key & nums[i]
                if new_key == k: count += prev[key]
                curr[new_key] += prev[key]
            
            prev = curr
        return count
